Deleuze “Bartleby; Or, The Formula”
http://research.uvu.edu/albrecht-crane/486R/bartleby_or_the_formula.pdf

“Bartleby; Or, The Formula” is an essay Deleuze published in the 1980s on Herman Melville's famous short story, "Bartleby the Scrivener." It is imperative that people read both the story and the criticism, not just the criticism.

This is a good case study of Deleuze's idiosyncratic approach to philosophical criticism of the arts in relation to social structure and capitalism. Those familiar with his seminal monographs on the work on Proust, Bacon and Kafka, will notice the Structuralist trend he inherited from his own mentors creeping into his treatment of Bartleby's mantra, "I'd prefer not to."
